title: System can be shut down without savefile warnings
OB: The system can be shut down without any warnings or prompts to save a file.
EB: The system should provide a dialog box with options to save the file or cancel the shutdown. The dialog box should have buttons for 'Yes' to save the file, 'No' to continue with the shutdown without saving, and 'Cancel' to halt the shutdown.
SR: To reproduce the issue, perform a shutdown of the system while there is an unsaved file. Note that there are no warnings or prompts to save the file before the shutdown occurs.
